intro: Blepharis breviciliata, commonly known as the short-haired blepharis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple and bloom during the warmer months. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes.
